alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Locally heavy rain continues tonight.

What:
Local rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 millimetres.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Scattered showers and thunderstorms are expected to continue tonight. The showers are expected to ease through Tuesday morning. 
Rainfall warnings may be required.

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. 
Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. 

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning are expected or occurring in the area.

A thunderstorm located near Barrie Island is moving northeast at 15 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Vessels without lightning protection should make their way to shore immediately. Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately.

affected_areas.area_description: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, at times heavy, continues.

What:
Local rainfall amounts of 50 to 60 millimetres.

When:
Continuing through Tuesday morning.

Additional information:
Rainfall amounts near 40 millimetres have been observed over some locations. 
Additional rainfall amounts of 10 to 20 millimetres is expected tonight. The showers are expected to ease Tuesday morning. 

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.
